During Zhao King Huiwen's time, they obtained the jade disk of Chu's He family. Qin King Zhao heard of this and sent someone with a letter to Zhao king, wishing to exchange fifteen cities for the jade disk. The Zhao king consulted with grand general Lian Po and the ministers: wishing to give it to Qin, fearing the cities could not be obtained, only being deceived; Wishing not to give it, then worried about Qin's troops coming. The plan undecided, they sought someone who could be sent to reply to Qin, but none found. Eunuch director Miao Xian said: 'My retainer Lin Xiangru can be sent.' The king asked: 'How do you know this?' He replied: 'I once committed a crime and secretly planned to flee to Yan. My retainer Xiangru stopped me, saying: "How do you know the Yan king?"' I told him: "I once accompanied the great king to meet the Yan king at the border. The Yan king privately grasped my hand, saying 'I wish to befriend you'." With this I know him, thus wished to go.' Xiangru told me: 'Zhao is strong and Yan weak, and you are favored by the Zhao king, thus the Yan king wishes to befriend you. Now you flee Zhao for Yan, Yan fears Zhao, the situation certainly dares not keep you, but will bind you and return you to Zhao.' You should rather expose your flesh and submit to the axe to beg forgiveness, then fortunately escape.' I followed his plan, the great king also fortunately pardoned me. I secretly consider him a brave man with wisdom and strategy, suitable to send.' Thus the king summoned and saw Lin Xiangru, asking: 'The Qin king wishes to exchange fifteen cities for my jade disk. Should I give it or not?' Xiangru said: 'Qin is strong and Zhao weak, cannot but agree.' The king said: 'If they take my jade disk but not give me cities, what then?' Xiangru said: 'If Qin seeks the jade disk with cities but Zhao does not agree, the fault lies with Zhao.' If Zhao gives the jade disk but Qin does not give Zhao cities, the fault lies with Qin.' Between these two strategies, better to agree and let Qin bear the fault.' The king said: 'Who can be sent?' Xiangru said: 'If Your Majesty has no one, I wish to carry the jade disk and go as envoy.' If cities enter Zhao, the jade disk stays in Qin; If cities do not enter, I beg to return the intact jade disk to Zhao.' The Zhao king thus sent Xiangru carrying the jade disk west into Qin.

translations.text: Xiangru saw the Qin king had no intention of paying Zhao cities, thus stepped forward saying: 'The jade disk has a flaw, please let me show Your Majesty.'

The Qin king angered, did not agree. Thus Xiangru stepped forward with the basin, knelt requesting the Qin king. The Qin king refused to strike the basin. Xiangru said: 'Within five paces, Xiangru begs to splash Your Majesty with my neck blood!' The attendants wished to attack Xiangru, Xiangru glared and berated them, the attendants all retreated. Thus the Qin king displeased, struck the basin once. Xiangru turned and summoned the Zhao scribe to write: 'Such year month day, Qin king struck basin for Zhao king.' Qin's ministers said: 'Please offer Zhao's fifteen cities as toast to the Qin king.' Lin Xiangru also said: 'Please offer Qin's Xianyang as toast to the Zhao king.' The Qin king finished drinking, ultimately could not gain advantage over Zhao. Zhao also massed troops ready for Qin, Qin dared not move.

sentences.zh: 既罷歸國，以相如功大，拜為上卿，位在廉頗之右。

translations.text: Having ended and returned home, because Xiangru's merit great, appointed upper minister, position above Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 廉頗曰：「我為趙將，有攻城野戰之大功，而藺相如徒以口舌為勞，而位居我上，且相如素賤人，吾羞，不忍為之下。」

translations.text: Lian Po said: 'I serve as Zhao general, have great merit of attacking cities and field battles, yet Lin Xiangru only labors with words, yet position above me. Moreover Xiangru originally base person, I ashamed, cannot bear being below him.'

sentences.zh: 宣言曰：「我見相如，必辱之。」

translations.text: He declared: 'If I see Xiangru, I will humiliate him.'

sentences.zh: 相如聞，不肯與會。

translations.text: Xiangru heard, refused to meet him.

sentences.zh: 相如每朝時，常稱病，不欲與廉頗爭列。

translations.text: Xiangru at court always claimed illness, did not wish to contend with Lian Po for position.

sentences.zh: 已而相如出，望見廉頗，相如引車避匿。

translations.text: Afterward Xiangru went out, saw Lian Po from afar, Xiangru turned his chariot to hide.

sentences.zh: 於是舍人相與諫曰：「臣所以去親戚而事君者，徒慕君之高義也。

translations.text: Thus his retainers together admonished: 'We left families and relatives to serve Your Lordship, only admiring Your Lordship's noble righteousness.'

sentences.zh: 今君與廉頗同列，廉君宣惡言而君畏匿之，恐懼殊甚，且庸人尚羞之，況於將相乎！

translations.text: Now Your Lordship and Lian Po same rank, Lian openly speaks ill and Your Lordship fears and hides, fear extremely great. Even common people still ashamed of this, how much more ministers and generals!

sentences.zh: 臣等不肖，請辭去。」

translations.text: We unworthy, beg to resign.'

sentences.zh: 藺相如固止之，曰：「公之視廉將軍孰與秦王？」

translations.text: Lin Xiangru firmly stopped them, saying: 'You consider Lian general compared to Qin king, who stronger?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「不若也。」

translations.text: They said: 'Not as good.'

sentences.zh: 相如曰：「夫以秦王之威，而相如廷叱之，辱其群臣，相如雖駑，獨畏廉將軍哉？

translations.text: Xiangru said: 'With the Qin king's prestige, yet Xiangru berated him in court, humiliated his ministers. Though Xiangru cowardly, how fear Lian general alone?'

sentences.zh: 顧吾念之，彊秦之所以不敢加兵於趙者，徒以吾兩人在也。

translations.text: I consider it: Strong Qin dares not use troops against Zhao, only because we two are there.'

sentences.zh: 今兩虎共鬬，其勢不俱生。

translations.text: Now two tigers fight together, their situation cannot both survive.'

sentences.zh: 吾所以為此者，以先國家之急而後私讎也。」

translations.text: I do this to put the state's urgency first and private enmity second.'

sentences.zh: 廉頗聞之，肉袒負荊，因賓客至藺相如門謝罪。

translations.text: Lian Po heard of this, exposed his flesh and carried thorns on his back, came through the retainers to Lin Xiangru's gate to apologize.

sentences.zh: 曰：「鄙賤之人，不知將軍寬之至此也。」

translations.text: Saying: 'This base person did not know the general's magnanimity reached this extent.'

sentences.zh: 卒相與驩，為刎頸之交。

translations.text: Ultimately they became harmonious, forming the friendship of cutting necks.

Moreover Xiangru originally base person, I ashamed, cannot bear being below him.' He declared: 'If I see Xiangru, I will humiliate him.' Xiangru heard, refused to meet him. sentences.zh: 是歲，廉頗東攻齊，破其一軍。

translations.text: This year, Lian Po attacked Qi east, breaking one of their armies.

sentences.zh: 居二年，廉頗復伐齊幾，拔之。

translations.text: Two years later, Lian Po again attacked Qi's Ji, capturing it.

sentences.zh: 後三年，廉頗攻魏之防陵、安陽，拔之。

translations.text: Three years later, Lian Po attacked Wei's Fangling and Anyang, capturing them.

sentences.zh: 後四年，藺相如將而攻齊，至平邑而罷。

translations.text: Four years later, Lin Xiangru led and attacked Qi, reaching Pingyi then stopped.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙奢破秦軍閼與下。

translations.text: The next year, Zhao She broke the Qin army below Yan.

This year, Lian Po attacked Qi east, breaking one of their armies. Two years later, Lian Po again attacked Qi's Ji, capturing it. Three years later, Lian Po attacked Wei's Fangling and Anyang, capturing them. Four years later, Lin Xiangru led and attacked Qi, reaching Pingyi then stopped. The next year, Zhao She broke the Qin army below Yan.

sentences.zh: 趙奢者，趙之田部吏也。

translations.text: Zhao She was a tax collector of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 收租稅而平原君家不肯出趙，奢以法治之，殺平原君用事者九人。

translations.text: Collecting rents and taxes, the Lord Pingyuan household refused to pay. She enforced the law against them, killing nine of Lord Pingyuan's influential retainers.

sentences.zh: 平原君怒，將殺奢。

translations.text: Lord Pingyuan angered, wished to kill She.

sentences.zh: 奢因說曰：「君於趙為貴公子，今縱君家而不奉公則法削，法削則國弱，國弱則諸侯加兵，諸侯加兵是無趙也，君安得有此富乎？

translations.text: She thus advised: 'You in Zhao are a noble lord. Now if your household violates and does not serve the public, then law diminished. Law diminished then state weak. State weak then feudal lords attack. Feudal lords attack means no Zhao. How can you have this wealth?

sentences.zh: 以君之貴，奉公如法則上下平，上下平則國彊，國彊則趙固，而君為貴戚，豈輕於天下邪？」

translations.text: With your nobility, serving the public according to law then superiors and inferiors equal. Superiors and inferiors equal then state strong. State strong then Zhao secure, and you noble relative—how slight compared to the world?'

sentences.zh: 平原君以為賢，言之於王。

translations.text: Lord Pingyuan considered him worthy, spoke of him to the king.

sentences.zh: 王用之治國賦，國賦大平，民富而府庫實。

translations.text: The king used him to manage state revenues. State revenues greatly balanced, people rich and treasuries full.

Zhao She was a tax collector of Zhao. Collecting rents and taxes, the Lord Pingyuan household refused to pay. She enforced the law against them, killing nine of Lord Pingyuan's influential retainers. Lord Pingyuan angered, wished to kill She. She thus advised: 'You in Zhao are a noble lord. Now if your household violates and does not serve the public, then law diminished. Law diminished then state weak. State weak then feudal lords attack. Feudal lords attack means no Zhao. How can you have this wealth? With your nobility, serving the public according to law then superiors and inferiors equal. Superiors and inferiors equal then state strong. State strong then Zhao secure, and you noble relative—how slight compared to the world?' Lord Pingyuan considered him worthy, spoke of him to the king. The king used him to manage state revenues. State revenues greatly balanced, people rich and treasuries full.

sentences.zh: 秦伐韓，軍於閼與。

translations.text: Qin attacked Han, encamped at Yan.

sentences.zh: 王召廉頗而問曰：「可救不？」

translations.text: The king summoned Lian Po and asked: 'Can we rescue?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「道遠險狹，難救。」

translations.text: He replied: 'The road distant and narrow, difficult to rescue.'

sentences.zh: 又召樂乘而問焉，樂乘對如廉頗言。

translations.text: Again summoned Le Cheng and asked, Le Cheng replied like Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 又召問趙奢，奢對曰：「其道遠險狹，譬之猶兩鼠鬬於穴中，將勇者勝。」

translations.text: Again summoned and asked Zhao She. She replied: 'The road distant and narrow, like two rats fighting in a hole—the braver will win.'

sentences.zh: 王乃令趙奢將，救之。

translations.text: The king thus ordered Zhao She to lead, rescue them.

Qin attacked Han, encamped at Yan. The king summoned Lian Po and asked: 'Can we rescue?' He replied: 'The road distant and narrow, difficult to rescue.' Again summoned Le Cheng and asked, Le Cheng replied like Lian Po. Again summoned and asked Zhao She. She replied: 'The road distant and narrow, like two rats fighting in a hole—the braver will win.' The king thus ordered Zhao She to lead, rescue them.

sentences.zh: 兵去邯鄲三十里，而令軍中曰：「有以軍事諫者死。」

translations.text: Troops departed Handan thirty li, then ordered in the army: 'Anyone who advises on military matters dies.'

sentences.zh: 秦軍軍武安西，秦軍鼓譟勒兵，武安屋瓦盡振。

translations.text: Qin army encamped west of Wuan. Qin army beat drums and shouted, mobilizing troops. Wuan's roof tiles all shook.

sentences.zh: 軍中候有一人言急救武安，趙奢立斬之。

translations.text: Among the army a scout reported urgent rescue of Wuan. Zhao She immediately executed him.

sentences.zh: 堅壁，留二十八日不行，復益增壘。

translations.text: Held firm the walls, stayed twenty-eight days without advancing, moreover increased the fortifications.

sentences.zh: 秦閒來入，趙奢善食而遣之。

translations.text: Qin spies came in, Zhao She fed them well and sent them away.

sentences.zh: 閒以報秦將，秦將大喜曰：「夫去國三十里而軍不行，乃增壘，閼與非趙地也。」

translations.text: The spies reported to Qin general, Qin general greatly pleased: 'Departed the state thirty li yet army does not advance, moreover increases fortifications. Yan is not Zhao territory.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢既已遣秦閒，卷甲而趨之，二日一夜至，今善射者去閼與五十里而軍。

translations.text: Zhao She having sent away Qin spies, rolled up armor and rushed forward. In two days one night arrived, ordered good archers to encamp fifty li from Yan.

sentences.zh: 軍壘成，秦人聞之，悉甲而至。

translations.text: Army fortifications completed. Qin heard of this, all armored and came.

sentences.zh: 軍士許歷請以軍事諫，趙奢曰：「內之。」

translations.text: Soldier Xu Li requested to advise on military matters. Zhao She said: 'Enter.'

sentences.zh: 許歷曰：「秦人不意趙師至此，其來氣盛，將軍必厚集其陣以待之。

translations.text: Xu Li said: 'Qin does not expect Zhao troops to come here. They come with strong spirit. General must densely gather the array to wait for them.

sentences.zh: 不然，必敗。」

translations.text: Otherwise, certainly defeated.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢曰：「請受令。」

translations.text: Zhao She said: 'Receive the command.'

sentences.zh: 許歷曰：「請就鈇質之誅。」

translations.text: Xu Li said: 'Beg to submit to axe and awl punishment.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢曰：「胥後令邯鄲。」

translations.text: Zhao She said: 'Afterward command Handan.'

sentences.zh: 許歷復請諫，曰：「先據北山上者勝，後至者敗。」

translations.text: Xu Li again requested to advise: 'First occupy the north mountain—the one above wins, later arrives defeated.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢許諾，即發萬人趨之。

translations.text: Zhao She agreed, immediately sent ten thousand to rush it.

sentences.zh: 秦兵後至，爭山不得上，趙奢縱兵擊之，大破秦軍。

translations.text: Qin troops arrived later, contended for the mountain could not ascend. Zhao She unleashed troops to attack them, greatly breaking Qin army.

sentences.zh: 秦軍解而走，遂解閼與之圍而歸。

translations.text: Qin army retreated and fled, thus lifted the Yan siege and returned.

Troops departed Handan thirty li, then ordered in the army: 'Anyone who advises on military matters dies.' Qin army encamped west of Wuan. Qin army beat drums and shouted, mobilizing troops. Wuan's roof tiles all shook. Among the army a scout reported urgent rescue of Wuan. Zhao She immediately executed him. Held firm the walls, stayed twenty-eight days without advancing, moreover increased the fortifications. Qin spies came in, Zhao She fed them well and sent them away. The spies reported to Qin general, Qin general greatly pleased: 'Departed the state thirty li yet army does not advance, moreover increases fortifications. Yan is not Zhao territory.' Zhao She having sent away Qin spies, rolled up armor and rushed forward. In two days one night arrived, ordered good archers to encamp fifty li from Yan. Army fortifications completed. Qin heard of this, all armored and came. Soldier Xu Li requested to advise on military matters. Zhao She said: 'Enter.' Xu Li said: 'Qin does not expect Zhao troops to come here. They come with strong spirit. General must densely gather the array to wait for them. Otherwise, certainly defeated.' Zhao She said: 'Receive the command.' Xu Li said: 'Beg to submit to axe and awl punishment.' Zhao She said: 'Afterward command Handan.' Xu Li again requested to advise: 'First occupy the north mountain—the one above wins, later arrives defeated.' Zhao She agreed, immediately sent ten thousand to rush it. Qin troops arrived later, contended for the mountain could not ascend. Zhao She unleashed troops to attack them, greatly breaking Qin army. Qin army retreated and fled, thus lifted the Yan siege and returned.

sentences.zh: 趙惠文王賜奢號為馬服君，以許歷為國尉。

translations.text: Zhao King Huiwen granted She the title Lord Ma Fu, appointed Xu Li as national defender.

sentences.zh: 趙奢於是與廉頗、藺相如同位。

translations.text: Zhao She thus with Lian Po and Lin Xiangru same position.
Zhao King Huiwen granted She the title Lord Ma Fu, appointed Xu Li as national defender. Zhao She thus with Lian Po and Lin Xiangru same position.

sentences.zh: 後四年，趙惠文王卒，子孝成王立。

translations.text: Four years later, Zhao King Huiwen died, son King Xiaocheng ascended.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦與趙兵相距長平，時趙奢已死，而藺相如病甐，趙使廉頗將攻秦，秦數敗趙軍，趙軍固壁不戰。

translations.text: Seventh year, Qin and Zhao troops confronted at Changping. At this time Zhao She already dead, Lin Xiangru ill in bed. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead against Qin. Qin repeatedly defeated Zhao army. Zhao army held walls not fighting.

sentences.zh: 秦數挑戰，廉頗不肯。

translations.text: Qin repeatedly challenged, Lian Po refused.

sentences.zh: 趙王信秦之閒。

translations.text: The Zhao king believed Qin's rumors.

sentences.zh: 秦之閒言曰：「秦之所惡，獨畏馬服君趙奢之子趙括為將耳。」

translations.text: Qin's rumors said: 'What Qin fears, only dreads Lord Ma Fu Zhao She's son Zhao Kuo as general.'

sentences.zh: 趙王因以括為將，代廉頗。

translations.text: The Zhao king thus appointed Kuo as general, replacing Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 藺相如曰：「王以名使括，若膠柱而鼓瑟耳。

translations.text: Lin Xiangru said: 'Your Majesty appoints Kuo by name, like gluing the tuning pegs and playing the zither.

sentences.zh: 括徒能讀其父書傳，不知合變也。」

translations.text: Kuo only can read his father's books and transmissions, does not know adapting to changes.'

sentences.zh: 趙王不聽，遂將之。

translations.text: The Zhao king did not listen, thus sent him.

Four years later, Zhao King Huiwen died, son King Xiaocheng ascended. Seventh year, Qin and Zhao troops confronted at Changping. At this time Zhao She already dead, Lin Xiangru ill in bed. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead against Qin. Qin repeatedly defeated Zhao army. Zhao army held walls not fighting. Qin repeatedly challenged, Lian Po refused. The Zhao king believed Qin's rumors. Qin's rumors said: 'What Qin fears, only dreads Lord Ma Fu Zhao She's son Zhao Kuo as general.' The Zhao king thus appointed Kuo as general, replacing Lian Po. Lin Xiangru said: 'Your Majesty appoints Kuo by name, like gluing the tuning pegs and playing the zither. Kuo only can read his father's books and transmissions, does not know adapting to changes.' The Zhao king did not listen, thus sent him.

sentences.zh: 趙括自少時學兵法，言兵事，以天下莫能當。

translations.text: Zhao Kuo from youth studied military strategy, spoke of military affairs considering no one in the world could match him.

sentences.zh: 嘗與其父奢言兵事，奢不能難，然不謂善。

translations.text: Once discussed military affairs with his father She, She could not refute him, yet did not consider it good.

sentences.zh: 括母問奢其故，奢曰：「兵，死地也，而括易言之。

translations.text: Kuo's mother asked She the reason. She said: 'War is the place of death, yet Kuo speaks of it easily.

sentences.zh: 使趙不將括即已，若必將之，破趙軍者必括也。」

translations.text: If Zhao does not appoint Kuo then fine, if must appoint him, the one who breaks Zhao army must be Kuo.'

sentences.zh: 及括將行，其母上書言於王曰：「括不可使將。」

translations.text: When Kuo was about to go, his mother presented a letter to the king saying: 'Kuo cannot be made general.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「何以？」

translations.text: The king said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「始妾事其父，時為將，身所奉飯飲而進食者以十數，所友者以百數，大王及宗室所賞賜者盡以予軍吏士大夫，受命之日，不問家事。

translations.text: She replied: 'At first I served his father. When he was general, those who presented food and drink to him numbered dozens, those he befriended numbered hundreds. What the great king and royal clan granted as rewards he all gave to army officers and scholars. On the day he received command, did not ask family matters.

sentences.zh: 今括一旦為將，東向而朝，軍吏無敢仰視之者，王所賜金帛，歸藏於家，而日視便利田宅可買者買之。

translations.text: Now Kuo once becomes general, faces east for court audience. Army officers dare not look up at him. What the king grants gold and silk, he takes home and stores, daily looks at profitable fields and houses to buy.'

sentences.zh: 王以為何如其父？

translations.text: The king considers how compared to his father?

sentences.zh: 父子異心，願王勿遣。」

translations.text: Father and son different hearts. I hope Your Majesty does not send him.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「母置之，吾已決矣。」

translations.text: The king said: 'Mother set it aside, I have already decided.'

sentences.zh: 括母因曰：「王終遣之，即有如不稱，妾得無隨坐乎？」

translations.text: Kuo's mother thus said: 'Your Majesty ultimately sends him, if he does not match expectations, may I not be implicated?'

sentences.zh: 王許諾。

translations.text: The king agreed.

Zhao Kuo from youth studied military strategy, spoke of military affairs considering no one in the world could match him. Once discussed military affairs with his father She, She could not refute him, yet did not consider it good. Kuo's mother asked She the reason. She said: 'War is the place of death, yet Kuo speaks of it easily. If Zhao does not appoint Kuo then fine, if must appoint him, the one who breaks Zhao army must be Kuo.' When Kuo was about to go, his mother presented a letter to the king saying: 'Kuo cannot be made general.' The king said: 'Why?' She replied: 'At first I served his father. When he was general, those who presented food and drink to him numbered dozens, those he befriended numbered hundreds. What the great king and royal clan granted as rewards he all gave to army officers and scholars. On the day he received command, did not ask family matters. Now Kuo once becomes general, faces east for court audience. Army officers dare not look up at him. What the king grants gold and silk, he takes home and stores, daily looks at profitable fields and houses to buy.' The king considers how compared to his father? Father and son different hearts. I hope Your Majesty does not send him.' The king said: 'Mother set it aside, I have already decided.' Kuo's mother thus said: 'Your Majesty ultimately sends him, if he does not match expectations, may I not be implicated?' The king agreed.

sentences.zh: 趙括既代廉頗，悉更約束，易置軍吏。

translations.text: Zhao Kuo having replaced Lian Po, completely changed the regulations, replaced army officers.

sentences.zh: 秦將白起聞之，縱奇兵，詳敗走，而絕其糧道，分斷其軍為二，士卒離心。

translations.text: Qin general Bai Qi heard of this, sent surprise troops, pretended defeat and retreat, cut their grain routes, divided their army into two, soldiers' hearts separated.

sentences.zh: 四十餘日，軍餓，趙括出銳卒自博戰，秦軍射殺趙括。

translations.text: Over forty days, army hungry. Zhao Kuo sent sharp troops to fight singly. Qin army shot and killed Zhao Kuo.

sentences.zh: 括軍敗，數十萬之眾遂降秦，秦悉阬之。

translations.text: Kuo's army defeated, several hundred thousand troops surrendered to Qin. Qin buried them all alive.

sentences.zh: 趙前後所亡凡四十五萬。

translations.text: Zhao previously and afterward lost altogether 450,000.

sentences.zh: 明年，秦兵遂圍邯鄲，歲餘，幾不得脫。

translations.text: The next year, Qin troops besieged Handan. Over a year, nearly could not escape.

sentences.zh: 賴楚、魏諸侯來救，乃得解邯鄲之圍。

translations.text: Relying on Chu and Wei feudal lords coming to rescue, then lifted Handan's siege.

sentences.zh: 趙王亦以括母先言，竟不誅也。

translations.text: The Zhao king also because Kuo's mother previously spoke, ultimately did not execute her.

Zhao Kuo having replaced Lian Po, completely changed the regulations, replaced army officers. Qin general Bai Qi heard of this, sent surprise troops, pretended defeat and retreat, cut their grain routes, divided their army into two, soldiers' hearts separated. Over forty days, army hungry. Zhao Kuo sent sharp troops to fight singly. Qin army shot and killed Zhao Kuo. Kuo's army defeated, several hundred thousand troops surrendered to Qin. Qin buried them all alive. Zhao previously and afterward lost altogether 450,000. The next year, Qin troops besieged Handan. Over a year, nearly could not escape. Relying on Chu and Wei feudal lords coming to rescue, then lifted Handan's siege. The Zhao king also because Kuo's mother previously spoke, ultimately did not execute her.

sentences.zh: 自邯鄲圍解五年，而燕用栗腹之謀，曰「趙壯者盡於長平，其孤未壯」，舉兵擊趙。

translations.text: From Handan's siege lifted five years, Yan used Li Fu's plan, saying 'Zhao's strong men exhausted at Changping, their orphans not yet grown', raised troops to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙使廉頗將，擊，大破燕軍於鄗，殺栗腹，遂圍燕。

translations.text: Zhao sent Lian Po to lead, attacked, greatly broke Yan army at Gao, killed Li Fu, then besieged Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕割五城請和，乃聽之。

translations.text: Yan ceded five cities to request peace, then heeded it.

sentences.zh: 趙以尉文封廉頗為信平君，為假相國。

translations.text: Zhao with Wei Wen enfeoffed Lian Po as Lord Xinping, as deputy prime minister.

From Handan's siege lifted five years, Yan used Li Fu's plan, saying 'Zhao's strong men exhausted at Changping, their orphans not yet grown', raised troops to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead, attacked, greatly broke Yan army at Gao, killed Li Fu, then besieged Yan. Yan ceded five cities to request peace, then heeded it. Zhao with Wei Wen enfeoffed Lian Po as Lord Xinping, as deputy prime minister.

sentences.zh: 廉頗之免長平歸也，失勢之時，故客盡去。

translations.text: When Lian Po was dismissed from Changping and returned, in the time of lost power, retainers all left.

sentences.zh: 及復用為將，客又復至。

translations.text: When again used as general, retainers again came.

sentences.zh: 廉頗曰：「客退矣！」

translations.text: Lian Po said: 'Retainers gone!'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「吁！

translations.text: Retainers said: 'Ah!

sentences.zh: 君何見之晚也？

translations.text: Why does my lord see this so late?

sentences.zh: 夫天下以市道交，君有勢，我則從君，君無勢則去，此固其理也，有何怨乎？」

translations.text: The world befriends by marketplace principles. You have power, I follow you. You have no power then leave. This is certainly the principle. What resentment?'

sentences.zh: 居六年，趙使廉頗伐魏之繁陽，拔之。

translations.text: Six years later, Zhao sent Lian Po to attack Wei's Fanyang, capturing it.

When Lian Po was dismissed from Changping and returned, in the time of lost power, retainers all left. When again used as general, retainers again came. Lian Po said: 'Retainers gone!' Retainers said: 'Ah! Why does my lord see this so late? The world befriends by marketplace principles. You have power, I follow you. You have no power then leave. This is certainly the principle. What resentment?' Six years later, Zhao sent Lian Po to attack Wei's Fanyang, capturing it.

sentences.zh: 趙孝成王卒，子悼襄王立，使樂乘代廉頗。

translations.text: Zhao King Xiaocheng died, son King Dao Xiang ascended, sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 廉頗怒，攻樂乘，樂乘走。

translations.text: Lian Po angered, attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled.

sentences.zh: 廉頗遂奔魏之大梁。

translations.text: Lian Po thus fled to Wei's Daliang.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙乃以李牧為將而攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.text: The next year, Zhao appointed Li Mu as general to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng.

Zhao King Xiaocheng died, son King Dao Xiang ascended, sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po. Lian Po angered, attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled. Lian Po thus fled to Wei's Daliang. The next year, Zhao appointed Li Mu as general to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng.

sentences.zh: 廉頗居梁久之，魏不能信用。

translations.text: Lian Po resided in Wei for long, Wei could not employ him.

sentences.zh: 趙以數困於秦兵，趙王思復得廉頗，廉頗亦思復用於趙。

translations.text: Zhao repeatedly troubled by Qin troops, the Zhao king thought of again obtaining Lian Po. Lian Po also thought of again being used in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙王使使者視廉頗尚可用否。

translations.text: The Zhao king sent envoys to see if Lian Po still usable.

sentences.zh: 廉頗之仇郭開多與使者金，令毀之。

translations.text: Lian Po's enemy Guo Kai gave much gold to the envoys, ordered them to slander him.

sentences.zh: 趙使者既見廉頗，廉頗為之一飯斗米，肉十斤，被甲上馬，以示尚可用。

translations.text: Zhao envoys having seen Lian Po, Lian Po for them ate one dou of rice, ten jin of meat, donned armor and mounted horse, to show still usable.

sentences.zh: 趙使還報王曰：「廉將軍雖老，尚善飯，然與臣坐，頃之三遺矢矣。」

translations.text: Zhao envoys returned reported to king: 'Lian general though old, still eats well, but sitting with me, in a moment relieved himself three times.'

sentences.zh: 趙王以為老，遂不召。

translations.text: The Zhao king considered him old, thus did not summon.

Lian Po resided in Wei for long, Wei could not employ him. Zhao repeatedly troubled by Qin troops, the Zhao king thought of again obtaining Lian Po. Lian Po also thought of again being used in Zhao. The Zhao king sent envoys to see if Lian Po still usable. Lian Po's enemy Guo Kai gave much gold to the envoys, ordered them to slander him. Zhao envoys having seen Lian Po, Lian Po for them ate one dou of rice, ten jin of meat, donned armor and mounted horse, to show still usable. Zhao envoys returned reported to king: 'Lian general though old, still eats well, but sitting with me, in a moment relieved himself three times.' The Zhao king considered him old, thus did not summon.

sentences.zh: 楚聞廉頗在魏，陰使人迎之。

translations.text: Chu heard Lian Po in Wei, secretly sent people to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 廉頗一為楚將，無功，曰：「我思用趙人。」

translations.text: Lian Po once became Chu general, no merit, said: 'I think of using Zhao people.'

sentences.zh: 廉頗卒死于壽春。

translations.text: Lian Po ultimately died in Shouchun.
Chu heard Lian Po in Wei, secretly sent people to welcome him. Lian Po once became Chu general, no merit, said: 'I think of using Zhao people.' Lian Po ultimately died in Shouchun.

sentences.zh: 李牧者，趙之北邊良將也。

translations.text: Li Mu was Zhao's fine northern border general.

sentences.zh: 常居代鴈門，備匈奴。

translations.text: Often resided in Dai and Yanmen, defending against Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 以便宜置吏，市租皆輸入莫府，為士卒費。

translations.text: With discretion appointed officials, market rents all entered the headquarters, for soldiers' expenses.

sentences.zh: 日擊數牛饗士，習射騎，謹烽火，多閒諜，厚遇戰士。

translations.text: Daily slaughtered several oxen to feast soldiers, practiced archery and riding, careful with beacon fires, many spies, generously treated warriors.

sentences.zh: 為約曰：「匈奴即入盜，急入收保，有敢捕虜者斬。」

translations.text: Made agreement: 'If Xiongnu enter to plunder, urgently enter and defend. Anyone who dares capture captives executed.'

sentences.zh: 匈奴每入，烽火謹，輒入收保，不敢戰。

translations.text: Xiongnu whenever entered, beacon fires careful, then entered and defended, dared not fight.

sentences.zh: 如是數歲，亦不亡失。

translations.text: Like this several years, also no losses.

sentences.zh: 然匈奴以李牧為怯，雖趙邊兵亦以為吾將怯。

translations.text: Yet Xiongnu considered Li Mu cowardly. Even Zhao border soldiers considered our general cowardly.

sentences.zh: 趙王讓李牧，李牧如故。

translations.text: Zhao king rebuked Li Mu. Li Mu as before.

sentences.zh: 趙王怒，召之，使他人代將。

translations.text: Zhao king angered, summoned him, made others replace as general.

Li Mu was Zhao's fine northern border general. Often resided in Dai and Yanmen, defending against Xiongnu. With discretion appointed officials, market rents all entered the headquarters, for soldiers' expenses. Daily slaughtered several oxen to feast soldiers, practiced archery and riding, careful with beacon fires, many spies, generously treated warriors. Made agreement: 'If Xiongnu enter to plunder, urgently enter and defend. Anyone who dares capture captives executed.' Xiongnu whenever entered, beacon fires careful, then entered and defended, dared not fight. Like this several years, also no losses. Yet Xiongnu considered Li Mu cowardly. Even Zhao border soldiers considered our general cowardly. Zhao king rebuked Li Mu. Li Mu as before. Zhao king angered, summoned him, made others replace as general.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，匈奴每來，出戰。

translations.text: Over a year, Xiongnu whenever came, went out to fight.

sentences.zh: 出戰，數不利，失亡多，邊不得田畜。

translations.text: Went out to fight, repeatedly unfavorable, losses many, border could not farm or herd.

sentences.zh: 復請李牧。

translations.text: Again requested Li Mu.

sentences.zh: 牧杜門不出，固稱疾。

translations.text: Mu shut doors not going out, firmly claimed illness.

sentences.zh: 趙王乃復彊起使將兵。

translations.text: Zhao king then strongly raised him to lead troops.

sentences.zh: 牧曰：「王必用臣，臣如前，乃敢奉令。」

translations.text: Mu said: 'Your Majesty must use me, I as before, then dare accept command.'

sentences.zh: 王許之。

translations.text: King agreed.

Over a year, Xiongnu whenever came, went out to fight. Went out to fight, repeatedly unfavorable, losses many, border could not farm or herd. Again requested Li Mu. Mu shut doors not going out, firmly claimed illness. Zhao king then strongly raised him to lead troops. Mu said: 'Your Majesty must use me, I as before, then dare accept command.' King agreed.

sentences.zh: 李牧至，如故約。

translations.text: Li Mu arrived, as former agreement.

sentences.zh: 匈奴數歲無所得。

translations.text: Xiongnu several years without gains.

sentences.zh: 終以為怯。

translations.text: Ultimately considered him cowardly.

sentences.zh: 邊士日得賞賜而不用，皆願一戰。

translations.text: Border soldiers daily received rewards without use, all wished one battle.

sentences.zh: 於是乃具選車得千三百乘，選騎得萬三千匹，百金之士五萬人，彀者十萬人，悉勒習戰。

translations.text: Thus selected chariots getting 1,300, selected cavalry getting 13,000 horses, soldiers of hundred jin 50,000 men, archers 100,000 men, all harnessed and practiced battle.

sentences.zh: 大縱畜牧，人民滿野。

translations.text: Greatly released livestock grazing, people filled the wilds.

sentences.zh: 匈奴小入，詳北不勝，以數千人委之。

translations.text: Xiongnu small entry, pretended north not winning, abandoning several thousand to them.

sentences.zh: 單于聞之，大率眾來入。

translations.text: Chanyu heard of this, greatly led masses to enter.

sentences.zh: 李牧多為奇陳，張左右翼擊之，大破殺匈奴十餘萬騎。

translations.text: Li Mu made many surprise formations, stretched left and right wings to attack them, greatly broke and killed Xiongnu over 100,000 cavalry.

sentences.zh: 滅襜襤，破東胡，降林胡，單于奔走。

translations.text: Destroyed Chanlan, broke Donghu, surrendered Linhu. Chanyu fled.

sentences.zh: 其後十餘歲，匈奴不敢近趙邊城。

translations.text: Afterward over ten years, Xiongnu dared not approach Zhao border cities.

Li Mu arrived, as former agreement. Xiongnu several years without gains. Ultimately considered him cowardly. Border soldiers daily received rewards without use, all wished one battle. Thus selected chariots getting 1,300, selected cavalry getting 13,000 horses, soldiers of hundred jin 50,000 men, archers 100,000 men, all harnessed and practiced battle. Greatly released livestock grazing, people filled the wilds. Xiongnu small entry, pretended north not winning, abandoning several thousand to them. Chanyu heard of this, greatly led masses to enter. Li Mu made many surprise formations, stretched left and right wings to attack them, greatly broke and killed Xiongnu over 100,000 cavalry. Destroyed Chanlan, broke Donghu, surrendered Linhu. Chanyu fled. Afterward over ten years, Xiongnu dared not approach Zhao border cities.

sentences.zh: 趙悼襄王元年，廉頗既亡入魏，趙使李牧攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.text: Zhao King Dao Xiang first year, Lian Po having fled to Wei, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng.

sentences.zh: 居二年，龐煖破燕軍，殺劇辛。

translations.text: Two years later, Pang Juan broke Yan army, killed Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 後七年，秦破殺趙將扈輒於武遂，斬首十萬。

translations.text: Seven years later, Qin broke and killed Zhao general Hu Che at Wushui, beheaded 100,000.

sentences.zh: 趙乃以李牧為大將軍，擊秦軍於宜安，大破秦軍，走秦將桓齮。

translations.text: Zhao appointed Li Mu as grand general, attacked Qin army at Yian, greatly broke Qin army, routed Qin general Huan Yan.

sentences.zh: 封李牧為武安君。

translations.text: Enfeoffed Li Mu as Lord Wuan.

sentences.zh: 居三年，秦攻番吾，李牧擊破秦軍，南距韓、魏。

translations.text: Three years later, Qin attacked Fanwu. Li Mu attacked and broke Qin army, southward opposed Han and Wei.

Zhao King Dao Xiang first year, Lian Po having fled to Wei, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng. Two years later, Pang Juan broke Yan army, killed Ju Xin. Seven years later, Qin broke and killed Zhao general Hu Che at Wushui, beheaded 100,000. Zhao appointed Li Mu as grand general, attacked Qin army at Yian, greatly broke Qin army, routed Qin general Huan Yan. Enfeoffed Li Mu as Lord Wuan. Three years later, Qin attacked Fanwu. Li Mu attacked and broke Qin army, southward opposed Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙王遷七年，秦使王翦攻趙，趙使李牧、司馬尚御之。

translations.text: Zhao King Qian seventh year, Qin sent Wang Jian to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Li Mu and Sima Shang to resist them.

sentences.zh: 秦多與趙王寵臣郭開金，為反閒，言李牧、司馬尚欲反。

translations.text: Qin gave much gold to Zhao king's favorite minister Guo Kai, for sowing discord, saying Li Mu and Sima Shang wished to rebel.

sentences.zh: 趙王乃使趙蔥及齊將顏聚代李牧。

translations.text: Zhao king sent Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju to replace Li Mu.

sentences.zh: 李牧不受命，趙使人微捕得李牧，斬之。

translations.text: Li Mu did not accept command. Zhao sent people secretly captured Li Mu, executed him.

sentences.zh: 廢司馬尚。

translations.text: Dismissed Sima Shang.

sentences.zh: 後三月，王翦因急擊趙，大破殺趙蔥，虜趙王遷及其將顏聚，遂滅趙。

translations.text: Three months later, Wang Jian urgently attacked Zhao, greatly broke and killed Zhao Cong, captured Zhao King Qian and his general Yan Ju, thus extinguished Zhao.

Zhao King Qian seventh year, Qin sent Wang Jian to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Li Mu and Sima Shang to resist them. Qin gave much gold to Zhao king's favorite minister Guo Kai, for sowing discord, saying Li Mu and Sima Shang wished to rebel. Zhao king sent Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju to replace Li Mu. Li Mu did not accept command. Zhao sent people secretly captured Li Mu, executed him. Dismissed Sima Shang. Three months later, Wang Jian urgently attacked Zhao, greatly broke and killed Zhao Cong, captured Zhao King Qian and his general Yan Ju, thus extinguished Zhao.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：知死必勇，非死者難也，處死者難。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: Knowing death must be brave—not dying is difficult, facing death is difficult.

sentences.zh: 方藺相如引璧睨柱，及叱秦王左右，勢不過誅，然士或怯懦而不敢發。

translations.text: When Lin Xiangru held the jade disk glaring at the pillar, and berated the Qin king's attendants, the situation no more than execution. Yet scholars or cowardly and dare not act.

sentences.zh: 相如一奮其氣，威信敵國，退而讓頗，名重太山，其處智勇，可謂兼之矣！

translations.text: Xiangru once aroused his spirit, awed and trusted the enemy state. Retired and yielded to Lian Po, name heavy as Mount Tai. His wisdom and courage can be called combined!

The Grand Historian says: Knowing death must be brave—not dying is difficult, facing death is difficult. When Lin Xiangru held the jade disk glaring at the pillar, and berated the Qin king's attendants, the situation no more than execution. Yet scholars or cowardly and dare not act. Xiangru once aroused his spirit, awed and trusted the enemy state. Retired and yielded to Lian Po, name heavy as Mount Tai. His wisdom and courage can be called combined!
